Description: Body sherd of Attic-black figured pottery open vessel, possibly a krater, with trace of handle on left; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of female to right, wearing a long chiton with dotted crosses in alternating squares and possible added white details and mantle (possibly in added red) with decorated border; at left, glaze traces and part of painted inscription.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 477, no. B826)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0227) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 96, pl. III, no. 18)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
